means: <正> 不停的，（好像）无休止的，不断的

sentence.Network_en: There is a ceaseless struggle from noon to night.
sentence.Network_cn: 从中午到夜晚，争斗没有停歇。

sentence.Network_en: This was what they achieved after scores of years of ceaseless labour.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是他们几十年不懈劳动取得的成果.

sentence.Network_en: This was what they achieved after two years of ceaseless military labour.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是他们两年不懈的军事训练取得的成果.

means.word_mean: 不间歇的,不断的,不停的
永无休止的,没有尽头的

entry.tran: (常指令人不快的事)不停歇的，无休止的，不断的
entry.def: If something, often something unpleasant, is ceaseless, it continues for a long time without stopping or changing.

example.ex: There is a ceaseless struggle from noon to night.
example.tran: 从中午到夜晚，争斗没有停歇。

means.word_mean: 1. uninterrupted in time and indefinitely long continuing;

sentences.sentence: "night and day we live with the incessant noise of the city"
"the perpetual struggle to maintain standards in a democracy"
"man's unceasing warfare with drought and isolation"

auth_sentence.content: His intelligence seemed as ceaseless as an engine working.
auth_sentence.res_content: His intelligence seemed as ceaseless as an engine working.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His intelligence seemed as ceaseless as an engine working.

auth_sentence.content: Ceaseless coal truck convoys tore up the roads.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ceaseless coal truck convoys tore up the roads.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ceaseless coal truck convoys tore up the roads.

auth_sentence.content: Fast and hot Against them pour'd the ceaseless shot.

means.word_mean: <正> 不停的;(好像)无休止的;不断的

sentences.en: Their ceaseless noise annoyed the neighbours.
sentences.cn: 他们吵闹不停,打搅了邻居。

sentences.en: This was what they achieved after two years of ceaseless military labour.
sentences.cn: 这是他们两年不懈的军事训练取得的成果。

sentences.en: This was what they achieved after scores of years of ceaseless labour.
sentences.cn: 这是他们几十年不懈劳动取得的成果。
